leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 材料-实验合成与表征自动化生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 采集→计划→执行→记录→复现/审计
leaf_cluster.tool_form: LIMS/设备接口 + 闭环平台

tools.name: ot2_workcell
tools.one_line_profile: ROS2 packages for Opentrons OT2 liquid handling operations
tools.detailed_description: A collection of ROS2 packages designed to operate the Opentrons OT2-based liquid handling operations for autonomous discovery laboratories.

tools.name: WEI
tools.one_line_profile: Workcell Execution Interface for Autonomous Discovery Laboratories
tools.detailed_description: A system for orchestrating and executing workflows in self-driving laboratories, managing the interaction between hardware and AI agents.

tools.name: lab_automation_tools
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts and tools for liquid handling systems automation
tools.detailed_description: A collection of automation scripts and resources specifically for liquid handling systems used in biological research.

tools.name: ML-EIT-Graphene
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Electrical Impedance Tomography software for graphene
tools.detailed_description: Software based on pyEIT and pyVISA for controlling instruments and performing automated Electrical Impedance Tomography (EIT) on graphene samples.

tools.name: nmea
tools.one_line_profile: NMEA 0183 protocol parser for marine electronics data
tools.detailed_description: A Rust library for parsing NMEA 0183 messages, commonly used for communication with marine sensors (GNSS, sonars, anemometers) in scientific data acquisition.

tools.name: pyLabLib
tools.one_line_profile: Library for device control and experiment automation
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing drivers and utilities for controlling various scientific devices and automating experiments.

tools.name: AtvK4200Lpt
tools.one_line_profile: Python control module for Keithley 4200 SCS
tools.detailed_description: A module to control the Keithley 4200 Semiconductor Characterization System (SCS) instrument functions from Python for materials science experiments.

tools.name: Instruments.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Instrument control library for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for controlling scientific instruments, facilitating hardware interaction in experimental setups.

tools.name: PyQLab
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for superconducting QIP experiment control
tools.detailed_description: A library for instrument control and automation of superconducting Quantum Information Processing (QIP) experiments.

tools.name: Source-Meter-PyMeasure
tools.one_line_profile: Keithley SourceMeter control using PyMeasure
tools.detailed_description: Code for controlling Keithley SourceMeter instruments using the PyMeasure library, developed at Duke University.

tools.name: Source-Meter-PyVISA
tools.one_line_profile: GPIB control for scientific instruments
tools.detailed_description: Scripts for operating scientific instruments via GPIB using PyVISA, developed for lab automation tasks.

tools.name: cam_acq
tools.one_line_profile: Client-server microscope control software
tools.detailed_description: A Python project to control microscopes through a client-server architecture, facilitating automated image acquisition.

tools.name: LabToolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Python module for instrument control and automation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for controlling laboratory instruments and automating experimental workflows.

tools.name: PycQED_py3
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum experiment control using QCoDeS
tools.detailed_description: Python 3 version of PycQED, a framework for measuring and controlling superconducting quantum circuits, using QCoDeS as the backend.

tools.name: hyperion
tools.one_line_profile: Unattended data collection for synchrotrons
tools.detailed_description: A system for unattended data collection at Diamond Light Source using the BlueSky data collection framework and Ophyd hardware abstraction.

tools.name: Impedance_Calibration
tools.one_line_profile: Calibration and fixture removal for impedance measurements
tools.detailed_description: Tools for calibration and de-embedding (fixture removal) in electrical impedance measurements, enhancing data accuracy for materials characterization.

tools.name: opentrons_code
tools.one_line_profile: Code for OpenTrons liquid handling robots
tools.detailed_description: Repository containing code and protocols for controlling OpenTrons liquid handling robots, used in biological engineering.

tools.name: OpenMGI
tools.one_line_profile: Open resources for MGI SP960 liquid handling robot
tools.detailed_description: Open knowledge sharing and potential control resources for the MGI SP960 Liquid handling robot, facilitating open lab automation.

tools.name: FINDUS
tools.one_line_profile: DIY 3-D printable liquid handling workstation
tools.detailed_description: Repository for the design and control of FINDUS, a DIY 3-D printable liquid handling workstation for low-cost lab automation.

tools.name: ot2-controller
tools.one_line_profile: SiLA 2 compliant controller for Opentrons OT-2
tools.detailed_description: A SiLA 2 (Standard in Lab Automation) compliant controller implementation for the Opentrons OT-2 liquid handling robot.

tools.name: panda-controller
tools.one_line_profile: SiLA 2 compliant controller for Franka Emika Panda
tools.detailed_description: A SiLA 2 compliant controller for the Franka Emika Panda robot arm, enabling standardized integration into lab automation workflows.

tools.name: sila-orchestrator
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic SiLA 2 client for service coordination
tools.detailed_description: A dynamic SiLA 2 client designed to orchestrate and coordinate various SiLA 2 compliant laboratory services and devices.

tools.name: GazeAtDS1054
tools.one_line_profile: Control and visualization software for Rigol DS1054Z oscilloscopes
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based viewer and control interface for the Rigol DS1054Z digital oscilloscope, communicating via USB or TCP. It allows researchers to visualize waveforms and control instrument parameters on Linux systems using PyVisa.

tools.name: Microscope-Control
tools.one_line_profile: Modular microscope control software in LabView
tools.detailed_description: A modular LabView-based software package for controlling microscopes, designed to facilitate super-resolution microscopy experiments by managing hardware components.

tools.name: OT2Control
tools.one_line_profile: Detailed control interface for Opentrons OT2 liquid handling robots
tools.detailed_description: Software designed to provide granular and detailed control over the Opentrons OT2 liquid handling robot, enabling customized automation protocols for biological or chemical laboratories.

tools.name: microscope-focus-lock
tools.one_line_profile: Arduino-based autofocus control system for microscopes
tools.detailed_description: A hardware and software solution using Arduino to implement active focus locking for microscopes, ensuring stability during long-term imaging experiments.

tools.name: SPICE
tools.one_line_profile: C++ implementation of the SiLA 2 standard for lab equipment
tools.detailed_description: SiLA Provider Implementation Community Equipment (SPICE) is a C++ library implementing the SiLA 2 (Standardization in Lab Automation) standard, enabling interoperability and control of laboratory instruments.

tools.name: cable_robot
tools.one_line_profile: Control software for custom cable-driven parallel robots
tools.detailed_description: A C++ repository for controlling and operating custom cable-driven robots, typically used in robotics research laboratories for precise manipulation or motion simulation.

tools.name: ImSwitch
tools.one_line_profile: General platform for controlling multiple microscope modalities
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based software solution for flexible control of complex microscope setups, supporting multiple modalities and hardware configurations for advanced imaging research.

tools.name: multi-channel-pipette
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source hardware and firmware for 96-well automated pipetting
tools.detailed_description: A complete open-source project including firmware and design files for a multi-channel pipette system capable of parallel liquid handling for 96-well plates, facilitating low-cost lab automation.

tools.name: SoftwareDefinedRadio4JUCE
tools.one_line_profile: SDR hardware abstraction layer for JUCE framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework providing a Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL) to interface Software Defined Radios (SDRs) within the JUCE environment, enabling signal processing and data acquisition for RF research.

tools.name: robotools
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for Tecan FreedomEVO liquid handling worklists
tools.detailed_description: A Pythonic library for in-silico liquid handling simulation and the generation of worklists for Tecan FreedomEVO robots, streamlining the automation of biological protocols.

tools.name: LabScript-AI
tools.one_line_profile: AI-powered generator for Opentrons liquid handling protocols
tools.detailed_description: A laboratory automation tool that leverages natural language processing to generate execution protocols for Opentrons robots, simplifying the programming of liquid handling tasks.

tools.name: SIM_Control_Software
tools.one_line_profile: Control software for Structured Illumination Microscopes
tools.detailed_description: Python-based control software specifically designed for operating Structured Illumination Microscopes (SIM), managing hardware synchronization and image acquisition.

tools.name: koheron-server
tools.one_line_profile: TCP/Websocket server for Koheron instrument control
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance server application for interfacing with Koheron instrumentation hardware (often used in laser/optics research) via TCP or Websockets.

tools.name: oic
tools.one_line_profile: Open Instrument Control library
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library designed for controlling scientific instruments, providing a framework for hardware abstraction and communication.

tools.name: ArmSym
tools.one_line_profile: Simulated VR laboratory for human-robot control experiments
tools.detailed_description: A virtual reality simulation environment designed for conducting human-robot interaction and control experiments, allowing researchers to gather data on human motor control and robot responses.

tools.name: GPIB-pyvisa
tools.one_line_profile: Python scripts for controlling instruments via GPIB
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts and utilities using PyVISA to control laboratory instruments via the GPIB interface, facilitating automated data acquisition.

tools.name: leicacam
tools.one_line_profile: Python library to control Leica microscopes
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for controlling Leica microscopes via TCP/IP, enabling automated imaging workflows and integration into custom lab software.

tools.name: bqev23k
tools.one_line_profile: Control software for TI EV2300 battery management interface
tools.detailed_description: A C# WPF application to control the Texas Instruments EV2300 hardware interface, specifically for the BQ40Z80 battery pack manager, useful for battery characterization and energy research.

tools.name: USBTMC-Host-Driver
tools.one_line_profile: Userspace driver for controlling USB Test and Measurement Class (USBTMC) instruments
tools.detailed_description: A C++ driver implementation for the USBTMC protocol, enabling communication with and control of scientific test and measurement equipment (like oscilloscopes and signal generators) over USB.

tools.name: lab-control-GUI
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable GUI for centralized scientific device control
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface designed for controlling various laboratory devices through a shared API, facilitating centralized management of experimental hardware.

tools.name: JISA
tools.one_line_profile: Java library for instrument control and experiment automation
tools.detailed_description: A standardized library for instrument control, data handling, and GUI creation, designed to simplify the development of experiment control programs in scientific research.

tools.name: Opentrons API
tools.one_line_profile: Control software and API for Opentrons liquid handling robots
tools.detailed_description: The core software and Python API for writing protocols and controlling Opentrons OT-2 and Flex liquid handling robots, widely used in biological and chemical lab automation.

tools.name: SerialMultiplexer
tools.one_line_profile: Control software for in situ serial multiplexing liquid handling robots
tools.detailed_description: Software for controlling a custom liquid handling robot designed for in situ serial multiplexing experiments, likely in biological imaging contexts.

tools.name: PyLabRobot
tools.one_line_profile: Hardware-agnostic SDK for liquid handling lab automation
tools.detailed_description: An open-source, hardware-agnostic Python library for controlling liquid handling robots (like Hamilton, Opentrons) and other lab automation equipment, providing a unified interface for protocols.

tools.name: Qcodes_contrib_drivers
tools.one_line_profile: Community drivers for QCoDeS data acquisition framework
tools.detailed_description: A collection of community-contributed instrument drivers for the QCoDeS data acquisition framework, enabling control of various scientific instruments in quantum computing and physics experiments.

tools.name: broadbean
tools.one_line_profile: Pulse sequence generation library for Tektronix AWGs
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for constructing and sequencing pulses, specifically designed to interface with Tektronix Arbitrary Waveform Generators (AWGs) for quantum computing and physics experiments.

tools.name: DS1054Z_screen_capture
tools.one_line_profile: Screen capture utility for Rigol DS1000Z oscilloscopes
tools.detailed_description: A Python utility to capture screenshots from Rigol DS1000Z series oscilloscopes via LAN using LXI SCPI commands, facilitating data documentation in experiments.

tools.name: neuroPG
tools.one_line_profile: Pattern generation and control tool for optogenetics
tools.detailed_description: An open-source MATLAB tool for DMD-based pattern generation, stimulation, electrical signal recording, and microscope camera control, specifically for optogenetics experiments.

tools.name: RsInstrument
tools.one_line_profile: Remote control library for Rohde & Schwarz instruments
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for remote control and communication with Rohde & Schwarz SCPI-based test and measurement instruments, providing a standardized interface for automation.

tools.name: qtplot
tools.one_line_profile: Data visualization tool for qtlab/QCoDeS datasets
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight data visualization application designed for quick plotting and analysis of data acquired using qtlab or QCoDeS frameworks in physics experiments.

tools.name: AgentLaboratory
tools.one_line_profile: Autonomous AI agent framework for research workflows
tools.detailed_description: An end-to-end autonomous research workflow system where AI agents assist researchers in planning, executing, and analyzing experiments, acting as a digital lab assistant.

tools.name: CAENpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python control for CAEN nuclear physics instruments
tools.detailed_description: A Python package to control CAEN digitizers and power supplies, commonly used in nuclear and particle physics experiments, providing a user-friendly interface over the low-level drivers.

tools.name: LeeQ
tools.one_line_profile: Pulse sequence orchestration for quantum computing
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for orchestrating and generating pulse sequences for quantum computing experiments, offering an easy-to-use syntax for experiment control.

tools.name: sdm
tools.one_line_profile: Instrument control and data acquisition framework
tools.detailed_description: SimpleDeviceModel (sdm) is an open-source framework for instrument control and data acquisition, providing a structure for managing experimental hardware.

tools.name: RxLab-Equipment
tools.one_line_profile: Smithsonian lab equipment drivers and applications
tools.detailed_description: A collection of PyVisa-based instrument drivers and control applications developed for Smithsonian labs, facilitating the automation of specific scientific equipment.

tools.name: ControlMotors
tools.one_line_profile: Motorization control for manual microscope stages
tools.detailed_description: Software and instructions for converting a manual microscope stage into a motorized one, enabling automated positioning and scanning in microscopy.

tools.name: XMOS-Fast-Shutter-Control
tools.one_line_profile: Shutter control for scanning transmission electron microscopes
tools.detailed_description: Firmware/software for a fast shutter control device used in Scanning Transmission Electron Microscopes (STEM), developed by SuperSTEM.

tools.name: BlueSky
tools.one_line_profile: Open source air traffic simulator for research and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive air traffic simulator designed for research into air traffic management (ATM) and aviation flows. It allows for the simulation of traffic scenarios to analyze capacity, safety, and efficiency.

tools.name: SEML
tools.one_line_profile: Slurm Experiment Management Library for reproducible research
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to manage and track scientific experiments on Slurm clusters. It handles hyperparameter search, job submission, and results logging, ensuring reproducibility in computational research.

tools.name: rohdeschwarz
tools.one_line_profile: Python instrument control toolbox for Rohde & Schwarz devices
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolbox for controlling Rohde & Schwarz electronic test and measurement equipment, facilitating automated data acquisition and device configuration in laboratory settings.

tools.name: navigate
tools.one_line_profile: Open source control software for light-sheet microscopy
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based control framework for light-sheet microscopes, enabling automated imaging sequences, hardware synchronization, and data acquisition for biological microscopy.

tools.name: EOS
tools.one_line_profile: Experiment Orchestration System for laboratory automation
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive software framework and runtime designed to orchestrate laboratory automation tasks, managing hardware interactions and experiment workflows.

tools.name: BrightEyes-MCS
tools.one_line_profile: Microscope Control Suite for advanced imaging experiments
tools.detailed_description: A control suite for custom-built microscopes, specifically designed for the BrightEyes project, facilitating advanced imaging techniques and hardware management.

tools.name: storm-control
tools.one_line_profile: Control software for STORM super-resolution microscopy
tools.detailed_description: A software package for controlling hardware used in Stochastic Optical Reconstruction Microscopy (STORM), including cameras, lasers, and stages, developed by the Zhuang Lab.

tools.name: qcodes_qick
tools.one_line_profile: QCoDeS driver for QICK-based FPGA quantum controllers
tools.detailed_description: A QCoDeS-compatible driver for the Quantum Instrumentation Control Kit (QICK) on FPGA boards, enabling integration of QICK into standard quantum experiment workflows.

tools.name: automancer
tools.one_line_profile: Application for designing and automating laboratory experiments
tools.detailed_description: A software tool that allows researchers to design, automate, and manage scientific experiments, providing a visual interface for protocol definition and execution.

tools.name: Cicero Word Generator
tools.one_line_profile: Control software suite for atomic physics experiments
tools.detailed_description: A user interface and control software suite designed for designing and running sequences on National Instruments digital and analog output cards, specifically for atomic physics experiments.

tools.name: oculus_m750d
tools.one_line_profile: ROS wrapper for Oculus M750d Multibeam Echosounder
tools.detailed_description: A Robot Operating System (ROS) wrapper for the Oculus M750d Multibeam Echosounder, enabling integration of this sonar device into robotics and marine research platforms.

tools.name: webusbtmc
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-based control for USBTMC test instruments
tools.detailed_description: A tool that enables control of test and measurement instruments directly from a web browser using the WebUSB API and USBTMC protocol, facilitating accessible instrument automation.

tools.name: HAL
tools.one_line_profile: Hardware Abstraction Layer library for robotics
tools.detailed_description: A hardware abstraction layer library developed by the Autonomous Robotics Perception Group, providing a unified interface for interacting with various robotic sensors and actuators.

tools.name: keyoscacquire
tools.one_line_profile: Data acquisition from Keysight InfiniiVision oscilloscopes
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for acquiring and saving traces from Keysight InfiniiVision oscilloscopes via a VISA interface, simplifying data collection in physics and engineering labs.

tools.name: tektronix-func-gen
tools.one_line_profile: Python control for Tektronix arbitrary function generators
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for controlling Tektronix AFG1000 and AFG3000 series arbitrary function generators via PyVISA, enabling automated signal generation.

tools.name: Coupling_ABAQUS_MATLAB
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for coupling ABAQUS FEM with MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: A framework for Software-in-the-Loop (SiL) simulation, enabling the coupling of ABAQUS Finite Element analysis with MATLAB for tasks like structural optimization and control system analysis.

tools.name: autolab
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for scientific experiment automation
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed for controlling laboratory instruments and automating scientific experiments, providing a unified interface for various hardware devices.

tools.name: flowchem
tools.one_line_profile: Instrument control application for flow chemistry labs
tools.detailed_description: An application to simplify the control of instruments and devices commonly found in chemistry labs, particularly for flow chemistry automation.

tools.name: pyTEM
tools.one_line_profile: Control and automation library for Transmission Electron Microscopes (TEM)
tools.detailed_description: A Python library developed by BASF for the control and automation of Transmission Electron Microscopes (TEM), enabling scripted experiments and data acquisition for materials science.

tools.name: easy-scpi
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for controlling SCPI-compliant laboratory instruments
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to simplify the control of test and measurement instruments that communicate via the SCPI (Standard Commands for Programmable Instruments) protocol, commonly used in physics and electronics labs.

tools.name: visa_serial_port_redirect_over_socket
tools.one_line_profile: Tunnel RS-232 VISA instrument interfaces over TCP/IP
tools.detailed_description: Scripts to enable network access to legacy laboratory instruments that only possess RS-232 serial interfaces by tunneling the VISA interface over a TCP/IP socket.

tools.name: Bluesky
tools.one_line_profile: Experiment orchestration and data acquisition system for synchrotrons
tools.detailed_description: A library for experiment orchestration and data acquisition, developed by Brookhaven National Laboratory (NSLS-II). It provides a high-level interface for controlling hardware, sequencing experiments, and collecting data in a structured way.

tools.name: Ophyd
tools.one_line_profile: Hardware abstraction layer for experimental equipment
tools.detailed_description: A hardware abstraction library that provides a consistent interface for controlling a wide variety of laboratory hardware (motors, detectors, etc.), primarily using EPICS, as part of the Bluesky ecosystem.

tools.name: ophyd-async
tools.one_line_profile: Asynchronous hardware abstraction for Bluesky
tools.detailed_description: The next-generation hardware abstraction library for the Bluesky ecosystem, written using Python's asyncio to support asynchronous device communication and control.

tools.name: pyvisa-proxy
tools.one_line_profile: Remote server and client for PyVISA instrument control
tools.detailed_description: A tool that enables remote control of laboratory hardware by acting as a proxy server and client for PyVISA, allowing instruments connected to one machine to be controlled from another over a network.

tools.name: pyseq2501
tools.one_line_profile: Controller to repurpose Illumina HiSeq as a microscope
tools.detailed_description: A Python controller that allows repurposing the Illumina HiSeq 2000/2500 sequencing platforms as epifluorescence microscopes with integrated fluidics control for custom experimental setups.

tools.name: eakins-camera
tools.one_line_profile: Socket-based control for Eakins microscope cameras
tools.detailed_description: A tool for controlling Eakins microscope cameras via network sockets, enabling automated image capture and settings adjustment for microscopy workflows.

tools.name: Pycrafter6500
tools.one_line_profile: Controller for TI DLP LightCrafter 6500
tools.detailed_description: A Python controller for the Texas Instruments DLPLCR6500EVM evaluation module, enabling 'pattern on the fly' mode for structured light applications in optics and microscopy.

tools.name: coPylot
tools.one_line_profile: Microscope control software
tools.detailed_description: A microscope control software package developed by CZ Biohub SF, designed to automate and orchestrate microscopy experiments.

tools.name: octave-instrument-control
tools.one_line_profile: Instrument control package for GNU Octave
tools.detailed_description: A package for GNU Octave that provides interfaces for controlling laboratory instruments via GPIB, USBTMC, VXI11, and VISA protocols.

tools.name: pyhamilton
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for Hamilton liquid handling robots
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for controlling Hamilton liquid handling robots (e.g., Microlab STAR), enabling automated biological and chemical workflows directly from Python scripts.

tools.name: Uni-Lab-OS
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated operating system platform for laboratory automation and device control
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive platform designed for laboratory automation, providing interfaces for controlling various lab equipment and orchestrating experimental workflows. Developed by DP Technology, it aims to standardize the interaction between software and hardware in scientific laboratories.

tools.name: CARBS
tools.one_line_profile: Command and control framework for autonomous swarm robotics based on Random Finite Sets
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for Command, Control, and Information (C2I) of autonomous swarms, utilizing Random Finite Set (RFS) theory. Developed by the Laboratory for Autonomy, GNC, and Estimation Research (LAGER), it facilitates the management of robotic swarms in research environments.

tools.name: GASUR
tools.one_line_profile: Guidance, Navigation, and Control library for autonomous swarms
tools.detailed_description: A Python package focused on Guidance, Navigation, and Control (GNC) for autonomous swarms using Random Finite Sets (RFS). Like CARBS, it is developed by the LAGER lab and provides algorithms for coordinating multiple autonomous agents.

tools.name: Dagger
tools.one_line_profile: Experiment orchestration platform for reproducible research
tools.detailed_description: A tool for orchestrating experiments, likely focused on machine learning or computational research workflows. Developed by Facebook Research, it aids in managing the execution and reproducibility of scientific experiments.

tools.name: BEMCom
tools.one_line_profile: Communication framework for building energy management hardware abstraction
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the rapid implementation of hardware abstraction layers (HAL) in the context of Building Energy Management (BEM). Developed by FZI Research Center for Information Technology, it allows unified communication with diverse hardware devices in energy research.

tools.name: overreact
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for creating and analyzing chemical microkinetic models
tools.detailed_description: A library to create and analyze chemical microkinetic models derived from computational chemistry data. Developed at the GEEM lab, it automates the generation of kinetic models for chemical reaction networks.

tools.name: Open Cezeri Library (OCL)
tools.one_line_profile: Matrix and computer vision library for robotic applications
tools.detailed_description: A Java-based library providing matrix operations, machine learning, and computer vision capabilities, designed for rapid development of robotic applications. Developed at Al-Jazari Laboratory, Siirt University.

tools.name: OpenLH
tools.one_line_profile: Open source liquid handling system based on robotic arms
tools.detailed_description: An open-source liquid handling system built upon the uARM swift Pro robotic arm platform. Developed by IDC-milab, it enables biological experimentation and exploration through accessible robotic automation.

tools.name: htSMLM
tools.one_line_profile: Micro-Manager plugin for unsupervised localization microscopy imaging
tools.detailed_description: An EMU plugin designed to control localization microscopes within the Micro-Manager environment, enabling unsupervised imaging workflows for Single Molecule Localization Microscopy (SMLM).

tools.name: PlatePlan
tools.one_line_profile: Planning software for high-throughput liquid handling
tools.detailed_description: Software designed to assist in planning high-throughput, combinatorial liquid handling dispenses, facilitating the design of experiments for automated laboratory robots.

tools.name: labscript-suite
tools.one_line_profile: Experiment control and automation system for quantum physics
tools.detailed_description: A metapackage for the labscript suite, a comprehensive system for experiment control, automation, and data acquisition, primarily used in quantum physics and atomic/molecular optics laboratories.

tools.name: python-labthings
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for creating RESTful lab hardware interfaces
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the LabThings framework, allowing researchers to create RESTful APIs for laboratory hardware to facilitate device control and automation integration.

tools.name: YouScope
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source microscope control software
tools.detailed_description: A microscope control software designed to automate imaging tasks, synchronize hardware components, and facilitate complex microscopy experiments.

tools.name: pyTecanFluent
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for TECAN Fluent liquid handling robots
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing an interface to control TECAN Fluent liquid handling robots, enabling automation of liquid dispensing tasks in laboratory workflows.

tools.name: mahi-daq
tools.one_line_profile: HAL for commercial Data Acquisition (DAQ) interfaces
tools.detailed_description: A Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL) designed to interface with various commercial Data Acquisition (DAQ) cards, providing a unified C interface for reading and writing analog/digital signals in research setups.

tools.name: camera-controller
tools.one_line_profile: Microscope camera control interface
tools.detailed_description: A user interface and control software for digital cameras attached to microscopes, developed for data acquisition in microscopy experiments.

tools.name: atomate2
tools.one_line_profile: Computational materials science workflows library
tools.detailed_description: A library of computational materials science workflows (e.g., for VASP, Amber) designed to run on high-performance computing resources using FireWorks or similar workflow managers.

tools.name: Contrast
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight data acquisition framework for beamline experiments
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based framework designed for orchestrating experiments and data acquisition at the MAX IV Laboratory beamlines, handling hardware communication and scan logic.

tools.name: Test_Equipment_Control
tools.one_line_profile: Control library for lab test equipment like battery testers
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for controlling various laboratory test equipment, specifically focused on battery testing and DC-DC converter testing automation.

tools.name: rssd
tools.one_line_profile: Rohde & Schwarz SCPI Driver
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing a driver interface for Rohde & Schwarz test and measurement instruments using SCPI commands.

tools.name: photonmover
tools.one_line_profile: Instrument control for optics and photonics labs
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for controlling scientific instruments commonly used in optics, photonics, and electronics laboratories.

tools.name: mesoSPIM-control
tools.one_line_profile: Acquisition software for mesoSPIM light-sheet microscopes
tools.detailed_description: Software for controlling hardware and acquiring images with mesoSPIM (mesoscale Selective Plane Illumination Microscopy) light-sheet microscopes.

tools.name: ExEngine
tools.one_line_profile: Execution engine for microscope control
tools.detailed_description: The execution engine component for Micro-Manager, handling the logic and sequencing of microscope control operations.

tools.name: Micro-Manager
tools.one_line_profile: Open source software for microscope control and image acquisition
tools.detailed_description: A widely used open-source software package for controlling automated microscopes and imaging devices, integrated with ImageJ.

tools.name: QCoDeS
tools.one_line_profile: Modular data acquisition framework for physics experiments
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based data acquisition framework developed by Microsoft, primarily used for quantum computing and condensed matter physics experiments to control instruments and manage data.

tools.name: CloudLab Automation
tools.one_line_profile: Automation scripts for Cloud Lab environments
tools.detailed_description: A repository hosting automation scripts and tools for managing and operating Cloud Labs (remote-controlled laboratory environments).

tools.name: PyVISA-mock
tools.one_line_profile: Testing framework for VISA-based instruments
tools.detailed_description: A library that allows mocking of VISA instruments, enabling the development and testing of instrument control software without physical hardware.

tools.name: dinolite_uvc_led_control
tools.one_line_profile: Control LEDs and UVC features for Dino Lite microscopes
tools.detailed_description: A Python module to control LEDs, auto-exposure, and other UVC controls specifically for Dino Lite USB microscopes.

tools.name: NICOS
tools.one_line_profile: Networked Instrument Control System
tools.detailed_description: A control system software used for controlling scientific instruments, particularly at neutron sources like MLZ.

tools.name: MicroFPGA
tools.one_line_profile: FPGA-based electronic control for microscope elements
tools.detailed_description: A platform using affordable FPGAs to control microscope hardware such as cameras, lasers, and servos, integrated with Micro-Manager.

tools.name: MicroFPGA-compatibility
tools.one_line_profile: Compatibility layer for MicroFPGA with Mojo FPGA
tools.detailed_description: Provides compatibility for controlling microscope elements using the Mojo FPGA board within the MicroFPGA ecosystem.

tools.name: MicroFPGA-py
tools.one_line_profile: Python communication package for MicroFPGA
tools.detailed_description: The Python interface for communicating with MicroFPGA-based microscope control hardware.

tools.name: DeepThought
tools.one_line_profile: Next-generation microscope control software framework
tools.detailed_description: A top-level repository for a microscope control software suite, designed to manage complex imaging experiments.

tools.name: uScopeControl
tools.one_line_profile: Hub for microscope control software
tools.detailed_description: A repository serving as a hub or framework for developing microscope control software.

tools.name: kekse
tools.one_line_profile: Rapid GUI building for instrument control
tools.detailed_description: A Python library based on PyQt5 for rapidly building Graphical User Interfaces for scientific instrument control.

tools.name: jds6600_python
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for JDS6600 signal generator control
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to remote-control Junce-Instruments JDS6600 signal generators over USB.

tools.name: UC2-Hi2
tools.one_line_profile: Automated multiwell plate imaging for UC2 microscopes
tools.detailed_description: Tools and scripts to control a GRBL-based Arduino Shield for automated multiwell plate imaging using the openUC2 microscope platform.

tools.name: slave
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight instrument control package
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python package designed to simplify the process of controlling scientific instruments.

tools.name: pcdsdevices
tools.one_line_profile: Ophyd device subclasses for LCLS PCDS
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Ophyd device subclasses specifically designed for the Photon Controls and Data Systems (PCDS) at the LCLS synchrotron facility.

tools.name: typhos
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic GUI generation for Ophyd devices
tools.detailed_description: A tool for automatically generating customizable Graphical User Interfaces for Ophyd-based scientific devices, used in synchrotron control systems.

tools.name: prpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python utilities and libraries for robotics control and integration in research labs
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python utilities and libraries developed and used by the Personal Robotics Laboratory (CMU) for robot control, planning, and integration, supporting various hardware interfaces and robotics frameworks.

tools.name: AROS
tools.one_line_profile: Open Automated Robotic System for Biological Laboratories
tools.detailed_description: An open-source automated robotic system designed specifically for biological laboratories to orchestrate and control various lab instruments and workflows, developed by the Pharmaceutical Bioinformatics group at Uppsala University.

tools.name: pyinstruments
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for controlling laboratory instruments
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing drivers and interfaces for controlling various laboratory instruments, facilitating data acquisition and experiment automation.

tools.name: PyMeasure
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific measurement library for instruments, experiments, and live-plotting
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python library for scientific measurements, offering a framework for controlling instruments, running experiments, and performing live data plotting and analysis.

tools.name: python-usbtmc
tools.one_line_profile: USBTMC driver for controlling instruments over USB
tools.detailed_description: A Python driver implementation of the USB Test and Measurement Class (USBTMC) protocol, enabling control of scientific instruments via USB interfaces without proprietary drivers.

tools.name: python-vxi11
tools.one_line_profile: VXI-11 driver for controlling instruments over Ethernet
tools.detailed_description: A Python driver for the VXI-11 protocol, allowing control of Ethernet-connected test and measurement instruments, compliant with the VXI-11 standard.

tools.name: python-microscope
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for control of microscope devices
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for high-performance control of microscope hardware, including cameras, stages, and light sources, supporting hardware triggers and distributed device control.

tools.name: PyVISA
tools.one_line_profile: Python bindings for the VISA library to control measurement devices
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that provides bindings to the Virtual Instrument Software Architecture (VISA) library, enabling standard control of measurement devices via GPIB, RS232, USB, and Ethernet.

tools.name: PyVISA-py
tools.one_line_profile: Pure Python backend for PyVISA
tools.detailed_description: A pure Python backend for PyVISA that implements the VISA standard protocols (like VXI-11, USBTMC, TCPIP) directly in Python, removing the need for proprietary binary VISA libraries.

tools.name: PyVISA-sim
tools.one_line_profile: PyVISA backend for simulating instruments
tools.detailed_description: A PyVISA backend that simulates the behavior of VISA instruments based on YAML configuration files, allowing for testing and development of instrument control software without physical hardware.

tools.name: QuMADA
tools.one_line_profile: Measurement Abstraction and Database Access layer for QCoDeS
tools.detailed_description: A library developed by QuTech that provides a measurement abstraction and database access layer on top of QCoDeS, facilitating quantum computing experiments and data management.

tools.name: wavebin
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for capturing and inspecting multi-channel oscilloscope waveforms
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool for parsing, analyzing, and visualizing binary waveform files captured from oscilloscopes (e.g., Keysight, Rigol), enabling detailed inspection of signal data.

tools.name: msox3000
tools.one_line_profile: Python control library for HP/Agilent/Keysight MSO-X/DSO-X 3000A Oscilloscopes
tools.detailed_description: A Python library utilizing PyVisa to provide remote control and data acquisition capabilities for Keysight MSO-X and DSO-X 3000A series oscilloscopes, enabling automated experimental workflows.

tools.name: oscope-scpi
tools.one_line_profile: SCPI-based Python control for Keysight Oscilloscopes (MSO-X/DSO-X/UXR/MXR)
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for controlling various Keysight oscilloscope models via SCPI commands over PyVisa, facilitating automated measurement and waveform data retrieval for scientific experiments.

tools.name: rust-hackrf-hal
tools.one_line_profile: Hardware Abstraction Layer for HackRF Software-Defined Radio
tools.detailed_description: A Rust-based Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL) for the HackRF software-defined radio platform, enabling low-level control and signal processing for RF analysis and physics experiments.

tools.name: Labelme
tools.one_line_profile: Image annotation tool for creating scientific training datasets
tools.detailed_description: A graphical image annotation tool used to label data for machine learning tasks, such as segmentation and object detection, widely applicable in biological and materials image analysis.

tools.name: SLM_control_GUI
tools.one_line_profile: GUI for controlling holographic imaging and stimulation microscopes
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based Graphical User Interface for controlling Spatial Light Modulators (SLM) in holographic microscopy setups, enabling precise optical manipulation and imaging.

tools.name: self-driving-lab-demo
tools.one_line_profile: Demonstration platform for autonomous experimentation (Self-Driving Labs)
tools.detailed_description: A software and hardware framework for setting up self-driving laboratories, featuring closed-loop control of LEDs and spectrophotometers with adaptive design algorithms for autonomous materials discovery.

tools.name: plmctrl
tools.one_line_profile: Control library for TI Phase-only Light Modulators (PLM)
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for controlling Texas Instruments Phase-only Light Modulators (DLP6750 EVM) via video interfaces, used in structured light and optical physics experiments.

tools.name: apriltag
tools.one_line_profile: Visual fiducial system for robotics and lab automation
tools.detailed_description: Extensions to the AprilTag visual fiducial system, widely used in laboratory robotics for precise object localization, camera calibration, and sample tracking.

tools.name: GLAS
tools.one_line_profile: Git-based Scheduling Architecture for Lab Automation
tools.detailed_description: An open-source, expandable architecture for scheduling and managing integral lab automation workflows, utilizing Git for version control and process management.

tools.name: COPICK
tools.one_line_profile: Colony picking framework for Opentrons OT-2 robots
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to adapt the Opentrons OT-2 liquid handling robot for automated colony picking protocols in microbiology workflows.

tools.name: curvequery
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for downloading waveform curves from Tektronix oscilloscopes
tools.detailed_description: A Python utility designed to simplify the process of querying and downloading waveform data (curves) from Tektronix oscilloscopes for analysis.

tools.name: srsgui
tools.one_line_profile: GUI framework for controlling Stanford Research Systems instruments
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework that allows users to create Graphical User Interfaces for controlling scientific instruments and running automated scripts, specifically tailored for SRS equipment.

tools.name: instrumentserver
tools.one_line_profile: Instrument sharing and administration server for QCoDeS
tools.detailed_description: A server application for sharing and administering laboratory instruments within the QCoDeS framework, facilitating multi-user experimental setups.

tools.name: plottr
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time plotting and data analysis tool for experiments
tools.detailed_description: A flexible Python tool for real-time plotting, monitoring, and analyzing data from scientific experiments, often used in conjunction with QCoDeS.

tools.name: turbo-ros-pkg
tools.one_line_profile: ROS packages for robotics and biology laboratory automation
tools.detailed_description: A collection of ROS (Robot Operating System) packages developed by the Robotics & Biology Laboratory at TU Berlin for controlling bio-robotics and automation hardware.

tools.name: AFL-agent
tools.one_line_profile: AI agent for autonomous decision-making in the NIST Autonomous Formulation Laboratory
tools.detailed_description: An AI agent implementation designed for the Autonomous Formulation Laboratory (AFL) at NIST. It facilitates autonomous experimentation cycles by making decisions on formulation and synthesis parameters based on experimental feedback.

tools.name: AFL-automation
tools.one_line_profile: Backend automation software and device drivers for the NIST Autonomous Formulation Laboratory
tools.detailed_description: The core automation infrastructure for the NIST AFL, providing a web-based backend for device integration, specific hardware drivers, and the orchestration logic required to run autonomous materials formulation experiments.

tools.name: hermes
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible framework for materials modeling and laboratory automation
tools.detailed_description: A Python package from NIST designed to support flexible materials modeling tasks and laboratory automation workflows, facilitating the integration of computational models with experimental procedures.

tools.name: labbench
tools.one_line_profile: Python scripting tools for streamlining laboratory automation tasks
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python scripting tools developed by NIST to streamline and simplify the process of automating laboratory equipment and experimental workflows.

tools.name: Robotic-Fish-Pose-Dataset
tools.one_line_profile: Dataset for robotic fish pose estimation from Peking University IBDLab
tools.detailed_description: A dataset dedicated to robotic fish pose estimation, developed by the Intelligent Biomimetic Design Laboratory (IBDLab) at Peking University, supporting research in biomimetic robotics and control.

tools.name: AutoScriptCopilot
tools.one_line_profile: State machine-based workflows for automated Transmission Electron Microscope (TEM) control
tools.detailed_description: A framework for automating Transmission Electron Microscope (TEM) experiments using state machine-based workflows. It leverages the nodeology framework and Thermo Fisher's AutoScript interface, developed at Argonne National Laboratory.

tools.name: Instrumentino
tools.one_line_profile: Modular GUI framework for controlling Arduino-based experimental instruments
tools.detailed_description: An open-source modular graphical user interface framework designed for controlling custom experimental instruments based on Arduino hardware, facilitating data acquisition and control.

tools.name: zhinst-qcodes
tools.one_line_profile: QCoDeS drivers for Zurich Instruments devices
tools.detailed_description: Official QCoDeS (Quantum Common Device Syntax) drivers for Zurich Instruments devices, enabling integration of these instruments into quantum computing and physics experiment workflows.
